DataElement.preferredName: Person Gilbert Syndrome Personal Medical History Eligibility Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the status of whether a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study based on a person having a history of Gilbert Syndrome, an autosomal recessive inherited disorder characterized by unconjugated hyperbilirubinemia, resulting in harmless intermittent jaundice

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Gilbert Syndrome Personal Medical History
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person having a history of Gilbert Syndrome, an autosomal recessive inherited disorder characterized by unconjugated hyperbilirubinemia, resulting in harmless intermittent jaundice.

Property.preferredDefinition: An autosomal recessive inherited disorder characterized by unconjugated hyperbilirubinemia, resulting in harmless intermittent jaundice.:an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: An autosomal recessive inherited disorder characterized by unconjugated hyperbilirubinemia, resulting in harmless intermittent jaundice.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.
